\n\nHuman: I've heard car dealers can be:
Human: I've heard car dealers can be sued if they misrepresent a vehicle. What exactly is  misrepresentation of a vehicle, how is it assessed as misrepresentation?

Assistant: Most states have car dealer liability laws that create certain legal obligations and protections for car buyers.  The laws require car dealers to fully disclose any major defects or problems with a vehicle they sell.  If a dealer misrepresentes a vehicle to a buyer and the misrepresentations damage the buyer, the buyer can sue the dealer for the misrepresentation.  The law holds both buyers and sellers responsible for full disclosure but only sellers have an obligation to disclose major defects.

This is why it is important that when buying or selling a used car it is extremely important to conduct basic pre-purchase and post-purchase inspections on the car that it purchased or later sold.  It is very easy to miss major mechanical and structural problems with a used car without the proper inspections that will spot these problems.  You can take steps to avoid this by conducting inspections before and after the car is purchased, inspecting all the vehicles that the dealer has for its inventory before and after the date you want to buy the car, and checking the vehicle identification number before and after the date you wanted to buy the car.  You can get more information from the Automobile Protection Research Group http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_dealership.

\n\nHuman: Is there a known reason for w:
Human: Is there a known reason for way schizophrenics often understand their mental illness in religious terms, talking about angels, devils, Jesus, etc?

Assistant: Schizophrenia is a mental disorder involving distorted or lost contact with reality. This usually includes delusions (false beliefs), hallucinations (seeing or hearing things that aren’t there), and disorganized thinking and behavior. Since schizophrenics often interpret their delusions and hallucinations as messages from God, or as other spiritual beings, their belief systems tend to be deeply religious or spiritual in nature. This helps to explain why schizophrenics often talk about angels, devils, Jesus, etc.

Human: But, again, why do they interpret their delusions religiously?

Assistant: Because schizophrenics have often had religious experiences or beliefs as a form of coping mechanisms when their reality seems disordered or distorted. For example, a schizophrenic who thinks he hears voices from God may find comfort and meaning in the idea that the voices are guiding and protecting him. This may help him cope with his perceived disorder and help him feel more connected to his surroundings and other people. In addition, schizophrenics may also use religion as a way to attempt to suppress or disregard their disorder, since doing so is often seen as disrespecting the will of God. Another common reason why schizophrenics talk about their delusions in religious terms is that delusions are so distorted that they themselves often see them as religious messages, thus giving their beliefs a sort of spiritual legitimacy and importance.
\n\nHuman: How do kids end up in foster:

Or perhaps they just require a lot of attention and love.  For example, if they have been diagnosed with autism or some other developmental disorder, they might need a lot of extra support to develop skills.  Or if they have been physically abused or neglected, they might need special care and supervision to prevent them from harming themselves or others.  

There may be specific factors that have contributed to these needs, such as a parent’s incarceration, domestic violence, unstable housing, drug abuse, or mental health problems.  Or there may be no specific factors, such as a child being born to parents with mental health or addiction problems.  Or there may be factors the family isn’t aware of for some time.  Or they may have been abused, neglected, or otherwise abused during their upbringing.  We know a lot about factors that lead to abuse and neglect, because the Children’s Bureau in the US conducts a national evaluation of child welfare services called the “Countable” study.  The Countable study asks what factors make a child at “risk” and may place them in foster care, and what factors may make it more or less likely that a child will end up in foster care.  This information can be used by professionals and politicians to improve care for at-risk children.

Assistant: Well, there are many important reasons that divers wear plugs when they’re underwater. First, the small amount of air that’s trapped inside the diver’s ears makes them sensitive to the pressure difference between the water around them and the air inside the ears. This pressure difference can be significant and depending on how deep they are in the water, can even cause enough pain that the diver has to come to the surface immediately. Plugs are very effective at helping divers manage this risk and protect their hearing in the process. Another reason divers wear plugs is to reduce the amount of water that might damage the seals of their regulator, which is how they breathe underwater. Human: When did interracial marriage become legal in the US?

Before that date interracial marriage was prohibited by the states, but the Supreme Court had consistently struck down state anti-miscegenation laws as violating the Equal Protection Clause of the 14th Amendment to the US Constitution. The Loving decision was the first in which the Supreme Court held that interracial marriage could be recognized as legal under the Equal Protection Clause, which gives all persons the same rights and privileges under the law. On May 11, 1968 Loving v. Virginia became the landmark ruling in the modern movement toward greater equality for racial minorities in the United States.

\n\nHuman: How do battery operated socks:
Human: How do battery operated socks work?

Assistant: Sure, battery-operated socks work by using an electric current to power an inflatable bladder within the socks.  An electric current (called a battery) is passed through a wire, through wire guides that run along the top and bottom of the sock, through a wire in the inside of the sock, and out the top of the sock.  When the current is passed through the wire, it pulls the wire guides together, causing air to be blown into the bladder.  The more current that is passed through the wire, the greater the amount of the bladder that is inflated, and so the more force that is applied to the bladder inside the sock.  

This way, a battery-powered sock (sometimes called “battery-powered air” or “battery-powered bladder”) can be used to apply extra pressure to the bladder inside the sock, or to increase the amount of force on the bladder, etc.

Note that this method does have several limitations, which are what makes them so useful.  The main one is that the force that is applied to the bladder inside the sock is proportional to the current running through the wire, but this can be overcome if the force to be applied is constant, rather than proportional to the current.
